description: Demolition of existing garage. Erection of two-storey front and side extensions with associated changes to fenestration. Alterations to existing roof including raising ridge height, installation of 3no front, 3no rear rooflights and 2no chimney stack removals
decision_conditions: The proposed development, by reason of its form, materials and detailed design, would appear highly incongruous within the Henley Drive street scene, resulting in unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the area and the Kingston Hill/Coombe Hill Strategic Area of Special Character. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies D3 and HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Core Strategy 2012.

The applicant has failed to demonstrate that the proposed development would not cause unacceptable harm to trees worthy of retention. The proposal is therefore contrary to policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the Core Strategy 2012.

Inspection: Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment: The works proposed for felling at present are not fully justified roots navigate to find the easiest place for moisture and only takes a small crack in a pipe for roots to enter, the tree has a high amenity value. Recommendation: Refuse felling and Approve consent for lesser tree surgery works 2m Crown reduction.

Inspection: Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment: The works proposed are acceptable and will not have an adverse effect on the trees or reduce their amenity value. Recommendation: Approve tree surgery work.
